BOZX, you need to include the partial English Subs. Some of these Blu-rays aren't hardcoded. Not your fault for them not being hardcoded, but you need to include those. For everyone else, those are available here: http://subscene.com/english/X-Men-First-Class/subtitle-473946.aspx

Also, I noticed too that my download for this and another 720p was really bad... TV shows take 5 minutes tops (200mb), but this took a few days. What gives? Is is a setting in uTorrent?

Finially, 720p IS HD. Anything above 1000px horizontal resolution is HD (720p is 1280 horizontal). Also, this is 720p. It is approx 2.3:1 Ratio, instead of 1.8:1, so it has black bars produced by your player to fill in the remaining vertical space. It essence, due to the aspect ratio, it has the same width as true 720p, but not the same height, so you get 544 vertical pixels instead of 720. Alternatively, the black bars could be encoded for a true 720p, but then the file would be bigger and harder to use, and the bars are typically off-black.
